meanings.definition: A tool with two jaws for gripping or bending objects.
meanings.sent1: I used the plyers to fix my bicycle chain.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic always carries a pair of plyers in his toolbox.
meanings.sent3: The plyers danced across the workbench, eager to help with any task.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers were like plyers, strong and precise in their movements.
meanings.sent5: The shiny plyers gleamed under the bright workshop lights.

meanings.definition: To use plyers to manipulate or work with objects.
meanings.sent1: He carefully plyers the wires together to create a circuit.
meanings.sent2: She plyers the nails out of the old wooden boards.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous gnome tried to plyers the garden gnome statues into funny poses.
meanings.sent4: She plyers through the tangled mess of wires like a skilled magician.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith deftly plyers the red-hot metal into shape.
